title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 240.4 - New districts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 240.4 - New districts

State Regulations
(a) In the
course of the formation of a new central school district, the district
superintendent of schools shall propose to the commissioner a name in
accordance with the provisions of this Part. Upon approval, such name will be
used by the commissioner in laying out such district. (b) In the course of the formation of a new
common or union free school district, the district superintendent shall propose
a name in accordance with the provisions of this Part. Upon approval by the
commissioner, the proposed name shall be the name of the school
district. (c) In the case of
unorganized school districts, the district superintendent shall propose a name
in accordance with the provisions of this Part. Upon approval by the
commissioner, the proposed name shall be the name of such district. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
240.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
